intro: Antitaxis calocarpa, commonly known as the pink-flowered antitaxis, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of pink or red flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically eaten by birds and small mammals, aiding in seed dispersal. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
